paper_title.ja: Jet-Type, Water-Cooled Heat Sink Achieves 255W CW Laser Output at 808 nm from a 1 cm Laser Diode Bar

paper_title.en: Jet-Type, Water-Cooled Heat Sink Achieves 255W CW Laser Output at 808 nm from a 1 cm Laser Diode Bar
Development of a two-dimensional birefringence distribution measurement system in laser-diode pumped solid-state laser material

description.en: We have developed a highly sensitive two-dimensional (2D) polarimeter that can sensitively measure the direction of the principal birefringence axis as well as the phase shift delta with its sign when delta < pi /4. The principle of polarimeter, system hardware, processing software, and calculated power loss will be described. The power loss due to thermal birefringence was evaluated quantitatively using the Jones matrix method. This polarimeter was successfully used to measure the 2D birefringence distribution in the laser-diode (LD) pumped solid-state laser material. The 2D thermal- and mechanical-stress-induced birefringence distributions were measured using the proposed polarimeter and compared to a calculated one with good agreement in a LD-pumped rod. The measured relative phase shifts induced by thermal effects and the simulation obtained by a three-dimensional analysis code of thermal birefringence in a LD pumped solid-state laser slab also were quantitatively in good agreement. We found that the developed polarimeter will be useful for developing high power and high beam quality LD pumped solid-state lasers. (C) 2001 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.ja: Quasi-CW 110kW Al Ga As Laser Diode Array Module for Inertical Fusion Laser Driver
Design and Performance of a Diode-Pumped Nd:Silica-Phosphate Glass Zig-Zag Slab Laser Amplifier for Inertidl Fusion Energy

paper_title.en: Quasi-CW 110kW Al Ga As Laser Diode Array Module for Inertical Fusion Laser Driver
Design and Performance of a Diode-Pumped Nd:Silica-Phosphate Glass Zig-Zag Slab Laser Amplifier for Inertidl Fusion Energy
THERMAL-AND SPECTRAL-CHARACTERISTICS OF HIGH-POWER QUASI-CONTINUOUS WAVE 940-nm InGaAs DIODE LASER ARREYS
LASER-DIODE PUMPED EIGHT-PASS 100-W CLASS Nd : YAG ZIG -ZAG SLAB LASER AMPLIFIER
Development of 100 kW laser diode module for 10 J x 10 Hz Nd : glass slab laser

description.en: High peak power laser diode arrays are required for pumping solid-state lasers toward the laser fusion driver. We will present a first successful achievement of a 100 kW peak power AlGaAs diode laser module as the pump source of 10 J x 10 Hz Nd:glass slab laser in order to verify a small scale experiment of the diode-pumped solid-state laser (DPSSL) driver for inertial fusion energy development. The total peak power of 110 kW was obtained at the diode current 120 A, the pulse width 200 mu sec and the duty cycle 0.2% (10 Hz). The peak intensity was more than 2.5 kW/cm(2) on the average over the emitting area of 418 mm x 10 mm. The center wavelength of this device was 803 nm at the cooling water temperature 17 degrees C, which designed in order to fit within the peak absorption line of Nd:glass (HAP-4) slab.

paper_title.en: EVALUATION OF THERMAL BIREFRINGENCE POWER LOSS IN THE LASER-DIODE PUMPED Nd : GLASS LASER
TWO-DIMENSIONAL HIGH-POWER LASER DIODE ARREYS COOLED BY FUNRYU HEAT SINK
Demonstration of high energy-extraction efficiency in a novel laser-diode pumped eight-pass Nd : YAG zig-zag slab amplifier

description.en: A novel laser-diode pumped eight-pass Nd:YAG zig-zag slab amplifier architecture was developed with the aim of achieving high energy-extraction efficiency. High energy-extraction efficiency of up to 71% for the laser mode volume has been achieved in this amplifier operating at an initial small signal gain of 3.25. The compensation of thermal birefringence in this amplifier was successfully performed. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science S.A. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Conceptual design of a laser-diode-pumped Nd : glass slab laser driver for inertial fusion energy

description.en: We have proposed and designed a laser-diode-pumped laser driver for inertial fusion energy (IFE) which consists of water-cooled zig-zag path Nd:glass slab amplifiers. A driver module was designed under the several operational constraints and has 10 W total output energy at 351 nm and operates at 12 Hz with 10.4% overall efficiency. The laser driver producing 4 MJ blue output for IFE will consist of 400 modules. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science S.A. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: All-solid-state tunable KTP optical parametric oscillator amplifier system

description.en: We present the performance charateristics of a low-energy all-solid-state near-infrared optical parametric oscillator amplifier (OPOA). The pump source is a laser diode (LD) pumped frequency-doubled Nd:YAG laser with a single mode energy of 4 mJ in 8 ns, 50 Hz pulses. The OPOA system, based on a potassium titanyl phosphate (KTP) crystal, features a low pump energy threshold at 532 nm of less than 0.4 mJ, broad tunability from 750 to 1040 nm for the signal, and a conversion efficiency of 27 % at 920 nm. The bandwith at 960 nm was reduced from that of the free-running mode (>100 GHz) to less than 150 MHz by the simultaneous injection seeding of the pump laser and the OPOA, and this is close to the Frourier transform limit for the 4 ns output pulses. The OPOA has a potential tunability of over 60 nm from 915 - 975 nm which is determined by its external cavity-grating-tuned-diode seed laser. The external cavity second-harmonic conversion of the idler to visible green-red light in type II KTP crystal and of the signal to visible blue-green light in type I BBO crystal was performed with efficiencies up to 10 %. We used the near-infrared output for wavelength-dependent fluorescence lifetime studies in yitterbium-doped laser materials. We also used the second harmonic wavelengths between 565 - 600 nm to measure the transmisssion of Nd:YAG in a preminary experiment to demonstrate the utility of the system.
